monster.name: Captain Aulruick Thoster

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the warlock's turns, each creature of its choice within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, provided that the warlock isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: When the swashbuckler makes a melee attack against a creature on its turn, that creature can’t make opportunity attacks against the swashbuckler for the rest of the turn, regardless of whether the attack hits.

trait.name: Rakish Audacity
entries: The swashbuckler adds its Charisma modifier to initiative rolls.

Additionally, the swashbuckler can deal Sneak Attack damage to a creature within 5 feet if no other creatures are within 5 feet of it and it doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll. The swashbuckler doesn’t need advantage on the roll to use Sneak Attack in this case.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warlock makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Venom Edge
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. If the sword is coated in venom via the Coat Blade bonus action, it also deals an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.

fluff.name: Warlock of the Great Old One

href.path: bestiary/MPMM/Warlock of the Great Old One.webp

entries: Warlocks of the Great Old One gain their powers through magical pacts forged with eldritch entities from strange and distant realms of existence. Some of these warlocks associate with cultists devoted to these entities, as well as Aberrations that share their goals, yet other warlocks of the Great Old One are experts at rooting out the chaos and wickedness inspired by bizarre beings from beyond the stars.

entries.name: Warlocks
entries: Warlocks gain arcane might through magical pacts with mysterious entities. While some use their abilities to serve the sources of their power, others use them to undermine or even destroy these entities.

bonus.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler takes the Dash or Disengage action.

bonus.name: Elegant Maneuver
entries: The swashbuckler gains advantage on the next Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) check it makes before the end of the turn.

bonus.name: Coat Blade
entries: The spinning discs on the sword spin to channel poison into the channels of the blade. Once done, any attacks made with the Venom Edge before the end of your next turn deal an additional {@damage 2d10} poison damage.

bonus.name: Awakened Mind
entries: As a bonus action, the warlock targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The warlock and the target can communicate telepathically with each other while within a number of miles equal to the warlock’s Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 mile). The connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to the warlock’s level, ending early if the warlock uses this feature again. Both creatures must share at least one language to understand each other.

actionHeader: The rogue deals an extra 5d6 damage when it hits a target with a finesse or ranged weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the rogue that isn’t incapacitated and the rogue doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll. The extra damage is of the same type as the weapon’s.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes three attacks, using Rapier or Pistol in any combination.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the pirate has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 30/90 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Piercing damage. If the pistol's gunpowder gets wet, the gun cannot be fired again again for the next 10 minutes, or unless a user takes a minute to dry it and reload.

bonus.name: Drunken Technique
entries: The pirate makes two unarmed strikes. Immediately after taking this action, the monk gains the benefits of the Disengage action, and its walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the current turn.

bonus.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler takes the Dash or Disengage action.

bonus.name: First Mate's Charm
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 14}, one creature the pirate can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the start of the pirate's next turn. It treats the pirate and the rest of its allies as non-hostile.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: {@actTrigger} The pirate is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The pirate adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. On a miss, the pirate makes one Rapier attack against the triggering creature if within range.

Pirate captains command crews of pirates, dictating their destinations and targets. Captains cultivate fearsome and theatrical reputations, painting themselves as larger-than-life characters to terrorize their foes, ensure the obedience of their crews, and attract followers to their banner. Many have colorful nicknames inspired by signature traits and deeds.

entries.name: Pirates
entries: {@i Freebooters and Fortune Hunters}
The term "pirate" encompasses a broad range of seafarers, including vicious sea rovers, dogged privateers, cursed treasure hunters, and others who seek riches and fame on the seas.

Pirates might be allies, foes, wild cards, or some combination thereof. While they are the bane of merchants and coastal communities, they know secrets of the sea and how to avoid aquatic threats. More unusual pirates set their sights beyond the waves, using airships, spelljamming vessels, plane-shifting craft, or stranger vehicles to explore and raid incredible realms.

entries.name: Pirate Flags
entries: To terrify opponents and spread their reputations, pirate crews fly distinctive flags. Roll twice on or choose results from the Pirate Flags table to inspire what flag a pirate crew sails under.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gharesi makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Verdant Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet closer to the professor.

bonus.name: Leap
entries: Gharesi jumps up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

entries.name: Animals
entries: Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they're named for or other similar creatures. For example, the {@creature Panther|XMM} stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the {@creature Giant Goat|XMM} stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

images.title: A druid calls on animals of the hills and mountains to aid her cause
Aquatic animals swim alongside a druid exploring the sea
Inhabitants of the rain forest answer a druid's summons

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wizard casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wizard makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Gravitic Well
entries: As an action, the wizard emits a powerful field of gravitational energy that lasts for 1 minute or until the wizard's {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends (as if {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell). For the duration, whenever a hostile creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the wizard, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} force damage and have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and every foot it moves that turn costs 3 feet of movement.

bonus.name: Gravitic Shift {@recharge 5}
entries: The wizard magically alters the weight of one object or creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must be Huge or smaller. The target’s weight is either halved or doubled (the creature's choice) for up to 1 minute or until the effect ends (as if {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell).

While the target’s weight is halved, its speed increases by 10 feet, it can jump twice as far, and it has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. While the target’s weight is doubled, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Necromancers study the interaction of life, death, and undeath. Some necromancers dig up or purchase corpses to create Undead servitors. A few instead use their powers for good, hunting Undead.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

trait.name: Gravitic Manipulation
entries: Whenever the wizard casts a spell on another creature, it can move the target up to 5 feet to an unoccupied space of the wizard’s choice, provided the target is willing to move, the spell hits with an attack, or the target fails its saving throw against the spell.

trait.name: Violent Attraction
entries: When a creature the wizard can see within 60 feet hits with a weapon attack, the wizard can use its reaction to increase the attack’s velocity. The target of the attack takes an additional {@damage 1d10} damage of the weapon’s type.
Alternatively, when a creature within 60 feet takes damage from falling, the wizard can use its reaction to intensify the impact. The creature takes an additional {@damage 2d10} damage.

reaction.name: Reactive Disruption (1/Day or with a 1st-Level Spell Slot).
entries: When a creature the wizard can see within 60 feet succeeds on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, the wizard can use its reaction to force the creature to reroll the {@dice d20} and use the lower result.

The wizard then chooses a different creature it can see within 60 feet (including itself). The chosen creature has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes within 1 minute. A creature can benefit from this feature only once at a time.

trait.name: Cargo Hauler
entries: The pirate has advantage on Strength checks.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The pirate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Vedalken Dispassion
entries: The vedalken has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Surge of Effort (1/Short Rest)
entries: On its turn, the creature can take one additional action, other than the Magic action. It can’t use this feature again until it finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Poisonous Pistol
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.

action.name: Hooked Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).

The bosun (or boatswain) is tasked with organizing the cargo and crew aboard a ship. Bosuns are capable fighters whose experience with hauling cargo and delivering beatings make them tough opponents. Foul Frithoff in The Sinister Secret of Saltmarsh is the bosun who protects the cargo aboard the smugglers' ship. Ever since a bad accident, he has worn a hook at the end of one arm in place of a hand.

bonus.name: Second Wind (2/day)
entries: As a bonus action, the fighter can regain {@dice 1d10 + 10} hit points. The fighter regains one use of this feature after finishing a short rest and all uses after finishing a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two attacks, using Frost Axe or Great Bow in any combination.

action.name: Frost Axe
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) Slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Cold damage.

action.name: Great Bow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 9}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) Piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Cold damage, and the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} decreases by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: War Cry {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant or one creature of its choice that can see or hear it gains 16 ({@dice 2d10 + 5}) {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} and has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the start of the giant's next turn.

entries.name: Frost Giant
entries: {@i Giant of the Ice and Snow}

From glacial mountain heights and vast tundras rise the homes of frost giants. These giants have skin and hair of icy hues. Their natural immunity to cold allows them to flourish in places inhospitable to most other creatures. They use this resilience to aid them when hunting and in combat, bolstering their allies with chilling war cries.

Frost giants often travel far to find food and goods. This leads many to become raiders and earn violent reputations. Others live more peaceably by hunting titanic game or creating sanctuaries from the cold (frequently featuring hot springs or snowy contests). Frost giants sometimes forge partnerships with icy Fey or fire giants dwelling underground, serving as guardians to their realms in exchange for treasure, weapons, and crafts.
The small folk have barely anything worth looting, so they shouldn't much mind when we take it from them.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Battleaxe attacks and one Harpoon attack.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target has the {@condition grappled} condition (escape {@dc 16}). While the target is {@condition grappled} this way, its speed isn't reduced, but it can't move farther from the giant. The target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The giant can grapple only one target at a time with its harpoon.

bonus.name: Reel In
entries: The giant pulls the target {@condition grappled} by its Harpoon up to 20 feet toward itself.

I learned enough about the Temple of Elemental Evil in my studies with Mordenkainen that I regard giants connected to the cult with a healthy amount of respect. When you combine a cultist's fanatical devotion with a giant's sheer power, the result can be horrifying.

Though primordials of frost and ice do exist (most notably Cryonax, who is sometimes considered almost the equal of the four Princes of Elemental Evil), frost giants who turn from the gods of the Ordning to embrace Elemental Evil are more likely to serve Olhydra, the Princess of Evil Water. To these giants, water is a cruel and destructive force that finds its ultimate expression in ice. These cultists of Evil Water often hide their allegiance as long as possible while urging their communities to everincreasing depths of cruelty and violence, but if the cultists' apostasy is revealed and they are exiled, they often end up as leaders of Olhydra's cults in colder regions.

Olhydra grants these frost giants the ability to breathe underwater, and they wield armor and weapons that reflect their commitment to the cult. Their armor is outfitted with enormous crossbows that can launch barbed harpoons, which the giants use to drag enemies into or through the water.

trait.name: Frost Rune
entries: The giant has a frost rune inscribed on a chunk of ice or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Ice Wolves action and Ice Armor reaction.

The object bearing the rune has AC 16; 40 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a frost rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes three attacks using Greataxe, Freezing Ray, or a combination of them.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) cold damage, and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition restrained} condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ice Wolves (Requires Frost Rune)
entries: The giant magically summons {@dice 1d4} wolves made of ice (use the {@creature winter wolf} stat block in the Monster Manual to represent them, but they are Elementals instead of Monstrosities). The wolves appear in unoccupied spaces the giant can see within 30 feet of itself. The wolves take their turn immediately after the giant on the same initiative count, and they obey the giant's commands. The wolves gain a +6 bonus to their attack and damage rolls while they are within 30 feet of the giant. The wolves disappear after 1 minute, when the giant dies, or when the giant uses this action again.

reaction.name: Ice Armor (Requires Frost Rune)
entries: When a creature the giant can see makes an attack roll against it, the giant can form a coat of ice around itself, granting it a +6 bonus to its AC against that attack. After the attack hits or misses, the ice shatters, and each creature within 5 feet of the giant must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

Frost giants who master rune magic are known as ice shapers, and their sheer power typically contributes to a meteoric rise in the giants' ordning. Many of them end up as jarls, leading their communities, or as advisers to jarls—often the true power behind the throne. They are usually devoted to Thrym.

True to their name, these ice shapers manipulate the raw elemental energy of air and water to wield ice in both offense and defense. They summon ice elementals in the shape of wolves, cloak themselves in icy armor, and just as quickly turn that armor into a hail of deadly ice shards.

trait.name: Extra Heads
entries: The giant has a {@chance 25} chance of having more than one head. If it has more than one, it has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The giant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Greataxe or Rock attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage, or 30 ({@damage 3d12 + 11}) slashing damage while raging.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Vaprak's Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The giant enters a rage. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:

items: The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

fluff.name: Frost Giant Everlasting One
entries: To hold its place or rise within the ordning, a frost giant must routinely face mighty foes in single combat. Some seek out magic that will aid them, but enchanted objects can be taken or lost. True greatness relies on personal prowess. Faced with this truth, a frost giant might seek a supernatural gift from Vaprak the Destroyer.

Vaprak is a ferocious god of strength and hunger also worshiped by some ogres and trolls. He likes to tempt frost giants with dreams of glory followed by nightmares of bloody cannibalism. Those who don't shrink from such visions or report them to priests of Thrym receive more of the same. If a frost giant comes to relish these dreams and nightmares, as some do, Vaprak sets a troll upon a sacred quest to find the frost giant and meet the giant in secret. The troll offers up its own body to be devoured in Vaprak's name. Only the boldest and most determined frost giants can finish such a gory feast.

After devouring the troll sent by Vaprak, bones and all, a frost giant becomes an everlasting one, gaining tremendous strength, an ill temper, and a troll's regenerative ability. With these gifts, the frost giant can swiftly claim the title of jarl and easily fend off rivals for decades. However, if the frost giant doesn't give enough honor to Vaprak or fails to heed Vaprak's visions, injuries the frost giant sustains heal wrong, resulting in discolored skin; warty scars; and vestigial body parts, such as extra digits, limbs, and even heads. The touch of Vaprak can no longer be hidden then, and the everlasting one is either killed or exiled by their clan. Sometimes small communities of everlasting ones gather and even reproduce, passing the "blessing" and worship of Vaprak from one generation to the next.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two attacks with its twisted ivory warhorn, one of which it may replace with a use of its compose verse ability.

action.name: Twisted Ivory Warhorn
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) Bludgeoning damage and the target is pushed 5 ft. away.
Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Compose Verse
entries: The frost giant declaims a verse of battle-poetry. Up to two friendly frost giants within 30 ft. that can hear it may use their reaction to make a melee attack.

action.name: Recite Refrain
entries: Each creature that understands Giant and can hear the giant within 30 ft. gains 10 temporary hit points. While a creature has these temporary hit points, its attacks score a critical on a 19-20.

entries.name: Frost Giant
entries: {@i Giant of the Ice and Snow}

From glacial mountain heights and vast tundras rise the homes of frost giants. These giants have skin and hair of icy hues. Their natural immunity to cold allows them to flourish in places inhospitable to most other creatures. They use this resilience to aid them when hunting and in combat, bolstering their allies with chilling war cries.

Frost giants often travel far to find food and goods. This leads many to become raiders and earn violent reputations. Others live more peaceably by hunting titanic game or creating sanctuaries from the cold (frequently featuring hot springs or snowy contests). Frost giants sometimes forge partnerships with icy Fey or fire giants dwelling underground, serving as guardians to their realms in exchange for treasure, weapons, and crafts.
The small folk have barely anything worth looting, so they shouldn't much mind when we take it from them.

reaction.name: Frosthunder Sounding (1/Day)
entries: As a reaction to being reduced below 81 hit points, the giant sounds its warhorn, releasing a blast of sound and cold in a 30- foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The ground in the area sprouts icy spikes, becoming difficult terrain for the next minute. When a Large or smaller creature moves into or within the area, it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

trait.name: Inspiring Prowess
entries: Whenever the giant reduces a creature to 0 hit points with an attack, each creature within 30 ft. makes attacks at advantage until the end of the giant's next turn.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The giant can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two attacks using its Greataxe, Freezing Ray, or a combination of them.

action.name: Frostshatter Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) cold damage. On a critical hit, the creature is instead pushed 30 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.
Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Ice Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of the frost giant's next turn.

action.name: Ice Wolves (Requires Frost Rune)
entries: The giant magically summons {@dice 1d4} wolves made of ice (use the {@creature winter wolf} stat block in the Monster Manual to represent them, but they are Elementals instead of Monstrosities). The wolves appear in unoccupied spaces the giant can see within 30 feet of itself. The wolves take their turn immediately after the giant on the same initiative count, and they obey the giant's commands. The wolves gain a +6 bonus to their attack and damage rolls while they are within 30 feet of the giant. The wolves disappear after 1 minute, when the giant dies, or when the giant uses this action again.

Frost giants who master rune magic are known as ice shapers, and their sheer power typically contributes to a meteoric rise in the giants' ordning. Many of them end up as jarls, leading their communities, or as advisers to jarls—often the true power behind the throne. They are usually devoted to Thrym.

True to their name, these ice shapers manipulate the raw elemental energy of air and water to wield ice in both offense and defense. They summon ice elementals in the shape of wolves, cloak themselves in icy armor, and just as quickly turn that armor into a hail of deadly ice shards.

reaction.name: Bitter Retort
entries: As a reaction to being attacked by a creature within 15 feet of it, the frost giant may force the attacker to make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throws. On a failed save, the attacker gains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) temporary hit points that last for one minute. While a creature has these temporary hit points, it is {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} and has vulnerability to fire damage.

monster.name: Frost Giant Jarl

trait.name: Frost Rune
entries: The giant has a frost rune inscribed on a chunk of ice or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Ice Wolves action and Ice Armor reaction.

The object bearing the rune has AC 16; 40 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a frost rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Ice Slick Aura
entries: A creature that begins its movement on the ground within 30 ft. of the frost giant must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity (Acrobatics) check or continue moving in a straight line until it runs out of movement, collides with a solid object, or leaves the aura.

trait.name: Battleready Ordning
entries: When initiative is rolled, the jarl and each friendly giant within 60 ft. may move up to its speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The frost giant makes two attacks with its runebearded story-axe, one of which it may replace with a use of its pillar of ice.

action.name: Runebeared Story-Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) cold damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away. On a critical hit, the creature's name is inscribed on the axe, and future attacks made against the creature with this weapon are made at advantage. Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Hurl Iceberg
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 60/140 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 27({@damage 6d8}) cold damage, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}. Each other creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Freezing Fog Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales a gout of freezing fog in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes heavily obscured for the next minute, or until cleared away by a strong wind.

reaction.name: Ice Armor (Requires Frost Rune)
entries: When a creature the giant can see makes an attack roll against it, the giant can form a coat of ice around itself, granting it a +6 bonus to its AC against that attack. After the attack hits or misses, the ice shatters, and each creature within 5 feet of the giant must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

Frost giants who master rune magic are known as ice shapers, and their sheer power typically contributes to a meteoric rise in the giants' ordning. Many of them end up as jarls, leading their communities, or as advisers to jarls—often the true power behind the throne. They are usually devoted to Thrym.

True to their name, these ice shapers manipulate the raw elemental energy of air and water to wield ice in both offense and defense. They summon ice elementals in the shape of wolves, cloak themselves in icy armor, and just as quickly turn that armor into a hail of deadly ice shards.

legendaryHeader: The giant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below.

legendary.name: Grip of Winter
entries: Swirling ice and snow descends in a 10 ft. radius centered on a point within 60 ft. for the next minute. A creature that starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on a turn takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage and has its movement reduced by half.

legendary.name: Eyes of the Storm
entries: The giant or one friendly creature within 30 ft. that it can see gains the ability to see unimpeded through fog and snow until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Sliding Cleave
entries: If the giant is not {@condition prone}, it falls {@condition prone}, slides 30 ft., and makes a melee attack. Large or smaller creatures in its path are pushed into the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The whalefolk deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: As an action, you can emit sound waves, gaining blindsight with a range of 60 feet for 1 minute. During this time, you are {@condition deafened} because of the intense sensory feedback.

trait.name: Whale Speech
entries: The whalefolk can comprehend and verbally communicate with whales.

trait.name: Jack of All Trades
entries: Bruce adds half of his proficiency bonus (+2) to any ability check with which he is not proficient.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whalefolk makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Anchor
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 8 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Thunder Bomb (3/Day)
entries: The whalefolk lights a grapefruit-sized bomb and throws it at a point up to 60 feet away, where it explodes. Each creature within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After the whalefolk throws the bomb, roll a {@dice d6}; on a roll of 4 or lower, the whalefolk has no more bombs to throw.

A giff shock trooper is trained to mount assaults on enemy strongholds. Each one is adept at softening up the enemy from a distance with firearms before charging into melee to mop up the foes that remain standing.

bonus.name: Inspiring Words (5/Day)
entries: When a creature Bruce can see within 60 feet of himself fails an ability check, an attack roll, or a saving throw, Bruce grants the creature magical encouragement. The creature can roll a {@dice d12} and add the number rolled to the total, potentially turning the failure into a success.
Alternatively, Bruce can expend a use of this feature to add a {@damage 1d12} psychic damage to an attack roll.

reaction.name: Inspiring Parry
entries: In response to being hit by an attack roll, Bruce rolls a {@dice d12} and adds the result to his armor class until the end of his next turn, potentially causing the attack to miss.
This uses a charge of his Inspiring Words feature.

trait.name: Extra Heads
entries: The giant has two heads. It has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The giant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Astral Harpoon
entries: The creature wields a magical silver harpoon that can be used as a melee or ranged weapon. The creature is proficient with it. The harpoon deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage (versatile {@dice 1d10}) and has the thrown (80/320 ft.) property. It can be summoned to the creature's hand as a bonus action. If thrown, the creature can teleport to the harpoon’s location as a bonus action, appearing in the nearest unoccupied space.

{@condition Ethereal Pinning}. On a hit, the creature can cause the harpoon to become ethereal and embed itself in the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become ethereally pinned for 1 minute. While pinned, the target cannot benefit from magical teleportation or planar travel, and its speed is halved as icy ethereal rime clings to the wound. Once removed, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

If a creature remains pinned for 30 consecutive days, it becomes subject to a Geas spell (save {@dc 18}) as its identity begins to unravel. The creature takes on a haunted, diminished appearance. The Geas ends early if the harpoon is removed, the effect is dismissed as an action, or if remove curse, greater restoration, or wish is cast on the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two Greataxe or Rock attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage, or 30 ({@damage 3d12 + 11}) slashing damage while raging.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Astral Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage in melee, or 11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage at range, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) piercing damage if used with both hands.
Additionally, the creature can choose to activate {@condition Ethereal Pinning} (see Astral Harpoon trait).

bonus.name: Vaprak's Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The giant enters a rage. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:

items: The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

fluff.name: Frost Giant Everlasting One
entries: To hold its place or rise within the ordning, a frost giant must routinely face mighty foes in single combat. Some seek out magic that will aid them, but enchanted objects can be taken or lost. True greatness relies on personal prowess. Faced with this truth, a frost giant might seek a supernatural gift from Vaprak the Destroyer.

Vaprak is a ferocious god of strength and hunger also worshiped by some ogres and trolls. He likes to tempt frost giants with dreams of glory followed by nightmares of bloody cannibalism. Those who don't shrink from such visions or report them to priests of Thrym receive more of the same. If a frost giant comes to relish these dreams and nightmares, as some do, Vaprak sets a troll upon a sacred quest to find the frost giant and meet the giant in secret. The troll offers up its own body to be devoured in Vaprak's name. Only the boldest and most determined frost giants can finish such a gory feast.

After devouring the troll sent by Vaprak, bones and all, a frost giant becomes an everlasting one, gaining tremendous strength, an ill temper, and a troll's regenerative ability. With these gifts, the frost giant can swiftly claim the title of jarl and easily fend off rivals for decades. However, if the frost giant doesn't give enough honor to Vaprak or fails to heed Vaprak's visions, injuries the frost giant sustains heal wrong, resulting in discolored skin; warty scars; and vestigial body parts, such as extra digits, limbs, and even heads. The touch of Vaprak can no longer be hidden then, and the everlasting one is either killed or exiled by their clan. Sometimes small communities of everlasting ones gather and even reproduce, passing the "blessing" and worship of Vaprak from one generation to the next.

monster.name: Emperor Thrym

trait.name: Frost Rune
entries: The giant has a frost rune inscribed on a chunk of ice or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Ice Wolves action and Ice Armor reaction.

The object bearing the rune has AC 16; 40 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a frost rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Ice Slick Aura
entries: A creature that begins its movement on the ground within 30 ft. of the frost giant must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity (Acrobatics) check or continue moving in a straight line until it runs out of movement, collides with a solid object, or leaves the aura.

trait.name: Battleready Ordning
entries: When initiative is rolled, the jarl and each friendly giant within 60 ft. may move up to its speed.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The frost giant makes two attacks with its runebearded story-axe, one of which it may replace with a use of its pillar of ice.

action.name: Runebeared Story-Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) cold damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away. On a critical hit, the creature's name is inscribed on the axe, and future attacks made against the creature with this weapon are made at advantage. Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Freezing Fog Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales a gout of freezing fog in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes heavily obscured for the next minute, or until cleared away by a strong wind.

action.name: Freezing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales a blast of frost in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 ({@damage 8d12}) cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, the target drops to 1 hit point instead and has the {@condition petrified} condition, turning into a frozen statue.
If the statue takes bludgeoning damage, it shatters, killing the frozen creature. If the statue would take fire damage, it instead takes no damage and thaws, ending the petrification.

action.name: Glacial Upheaval {@recharge 5}
entries: The scion digs its hands into the ground at a point it can see within 30 feet of itself and launches a magically conjured mass of ice into the air. Each creature other than the scion in a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 19 ({@damage 3d12}) cold damage and is pushed vertically to the top of the cylinder, at which point the creature falls. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder with no additional effects.

At the start of the scion's next turn, a mass of ice plummets to the ground on a point the scion can see within 60 feet of the point the scion dug its hands into. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

reaction.name: Ice Armor (Requires Frost Rune)
entries: When a creature the giant can see makes an attack roll against it, the giant can form a coat of ice around itself, granting it a +6 bonus to its AC against that attack. After the attack hits or misses, the ice shatters, and each creature within 5 feet of the giant must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

Frost giants who master rune magic are known as ice shapers, and their sheer power typically contributes to a meteoric rise in the giants' ordning. Many of them end up as jarls, leading their communities, or as advisers to jarls—often the true power behind the throne. They are usually devoted to Thrym.

True to their name, these ice shapers manipulate the raw elemental energy of air and water to wield ice in both offense and defense. They summon ice elementals in the shape of wolves, cloak themselves in icy armor, and just as quickly turn that armor into a hail of deadly ice shards.

legendary.name: Grip of Winter

legendary.name: Eyes of the Storm
entries: The giant or one friendly creature within 30 ft. that it can see gains the ability to see unimpeded through fog and snow until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Sliding Cleave
entries: If the giant is not {@condition prone}, it falls {@condition prone}, slides 30 ft., and makes a melee attack. Large or smaller creatures in its path are pushed into the nearest unoccupied space.

bonus.name: Chilling Mist.
entries: The giant magically conjures a cloud of chilling mist that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The mist spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage and be unable to use reactions until the start of its next turn. The mist vanishes at the end of the giant's turn.

monster.name: Empress Gerti

trait.name: Frost Rune
entries: The giant has a frost rune inscribed on a chunk of ice or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Ice Wolves action and Ice Armor reaction.

The object bearing the rune has AC 16; 40 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a frost rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Hurl Iceberg
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 60/140 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 27({@damage 6d8}) cold damage, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}. Each other creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Freezing Fog Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales a gout of freezing fog in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes heavily obscured for the next minute, or until cleared away by a strong wind.

After the attack hits or misses, the ice shatters, and each creature within 5 feet of the giant must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

True to their name, these ice shapers manipulate the raw elemental energy of air and water to wield ice in both offense and defense. They summon ice elementals in the shape of wolves, cloak themselves in icy armor, and just as quickly turn that armor into a hail of deadly ice shards.

legendaryHeader: The giant can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. While inside of her lair, she can take 5 legendary actions instead.

legendary.name: Grip of Winter
entries: Swirling ice and snow descends in a 10 ft. radius centered on a point within 60 ft. for the next minute. A creature that starts its turn in the area or enters it for the first time on a turn takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage and has its movement reduced by half.

legendary.name: Eyes of the Storm
entries: The giant or one friendly creature within 30 ft. that it can see gains the ability to see unimpeded through fog and snow until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Sliding Cleave
entries: If the giant is not {@condition prone}, it falls {@condition prone}, slides 30 ft., and makes a melee attack. Large or smaller creatures in its path are pushed into the nearest unoccupied space.

legendary.name: Wintry Swirl (Costs 2 Actions).
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the Snow Queen must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or have vulnerability to cold damage until the end of its next turn. A creature with immunity to cold damage that fails this saving throw instead loses its immunity to cold damage but isn't vulnerable to it.
